chh.util

Class Number

  • java.lang.Object
    • chh.util.Number

  • public final class Number
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class containing calculations on natural numbers (non-negative integers).
    Version:
    2013.06.14
    Author:
    Christopher H. Harvey

    • Method Detail

      • bound

        public static double bound(double x,
           double lower,
           double upper)
        Returns the number closest to the given parameter within a specified interval. If the parameter is in the interval (inclusive), the method returns the number. If the parameter is outside the interval, the method returns the closest bound (either upper or lower). For example, Number.bound(3.14, 0, 1) will return 1.0. This method does not change the value of the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        x - the number to be tested
        lower - the lower bound, inclusive
        upper - the upper bound, inclusive. Must be >= lower.
        Returns:
        the closest number to x within the interval [lower, upper]

      • bound

        public static int bound(int x,
        int lower,
        int upper)
        Performs Number.bound() on ints rather than doubles.
        Parameters:
        x - the number to be tested
        lower - the lower bound, inclusive
        upper - the upper bound, inclusive. Must be >= lower.
        Returns:
        the closest number to x within the interval [lower, upper]

      • bound

        public static double[] bound(double[] nums,
             double lower,
             double upper)
        Performs Number.bound() on each entry of an array, using the same interval for comparison.
        Parameters:
        nums - The array of numbers to be tested
        lower - the lower bound, inclusive
        upper - the upper bound, inclusive. Must be >= lower.
        Returns:
        an array of numbers containing Number.bound(nums[i])

      • max

        public static double max(double[] nums)
        Gives the maximum value in an array of doubles.
        Parameters:
        nums - the array to check. Must be non-empty and length != 0.
        Returns:
        the maximum double in the array

      • min

        public static double min(double[] nums)
        Gives the minimum value in an array of doubles.
        Parameters:
        nums - the array to check. Must be non-empty and length != 0.
        Returns:
        the minimum double in the array

      • isPrime

        public static boolean isPrime(int n)
        Returns whether a given integer is prime. An integer is mathematically prime if and only if its only integer divisors are itself and 1.
        Parameters:
        n - the given integer
        Returns:
        true if n is prime

      • isPowerOf

        public static boolean isPowerOf(int n,
                int r)
        Determines whether a given integer n is a power of an integer r.
        Parameters:
        n - the given integer to test
        r - the given root
        Returns:
        true if n is a power of r

      • factor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> factor(int n)
        Returns an ArrayList of all of the prime factors of the given number.
        Parameters:
        n - the given number to be factored
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing Integer objects, which are prime factors of n, in increasing order

      • gcf

        public static int gcf(int n,
      int r)
        Gives the greatest common factor of two numbers.
        Parameters:
        n - the first integer
        r - the second integer
        Returns:
        the greatest integer factor that n and r have in common

      • lcm

        public static int lcm(int n,
      int r)
        Gives the least common multiple of two numbers. DRAFT. Returns 0 for now.
        Parameters:
        n - the first integer
        r - the second integer
        Returns:
        the least multiple that n and r have in common

      • average

        public static double average(double a,
             double b,
             double w)
        Averages two numbers, with a given weight favoring the first number. For example, Number.average(10, 20, 0.7) will return 13, while Number.average(20, 10, 0.7) will return 17.
        Parameters:
        a - The first number, to be weighted by w
        b - the second number
        w - the weight that favors a. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0
        Returns:
        the weighted average of a and b

      • average

        public static double average(double a,
             double b)
        Averages two numbers with even weight. Same result as Number.aMean(a, b).
        Parameters:
        a - the first number
        b - the second number
        Returns:
        the average of a and b with even weight

      • aMean

        public static double aMean(double a,
           double b)
        Returns the arithmetic mean of two doubles. The arithmetic mean of a and b is exactly half of the sum of a and b.
        Parameters:
        a - the first double
        b - the second double
        Returns:
        the arithmetic mean of a and b

      • aMean

        public static double aMean(double[] nums)
        Returns the arithmetic mean of an array of doubles.
        Parameters:
        nums - the array of doubles, with undetermined length
        Returns:
        the arithmetic mean of all the doubles in the array

      • gMean

        public static double gMean(double a,
           double b)
        Returns the geometric mean of two doubles. The geometric mean of 'a' and 'b' is the exact square root of the product of 'a' and 'b'.
        Parameters:
        a - the first double
        b - the second double
        Returns:
        the geometric mean of a and b

      • gMean

        public static double gMean(double[] doubles)
        Returns the geometric mean of an array of doubles. Mathematical note: if any entry in the given array is equal to 0, then this method will return 0.0.
        Parameters:
        doubles - the array of doubles, with undetermined length
        Returns:
        the geometric mean of all the doubles in the array

      • log

        public static double log(double x,
         double b)
        Returns the logarithm base b of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the argument of the logarithm
        b - the base of the logarithm
        Returns:
        log_{b} (x)

        public static double log2(double x)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        log_{2} (x)

        Returns:
        log_{10} (x)

      • ln

        public static double ln(double x)
        Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the argument of the logarithm
        Returns:
        ln (x)
